A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
With a few exceptions\, this movie was satisfying\, more so than TFA\, in my opinion.

SPOILERS:

Pros:  Strong women characters\, visually stunning\, elements of the Force that are unprecedented but could make sense\, seeing Rey and Kylo connect\, even if briefly

Cons:  Certain details that defy explanation (e.g.\, Leia's near-death experience\, Yoda's ability to use the Force from beyond the grave); Poe's rogue behaviors and his lack of appropriate remorse; the awkward humor

Special mention for nostalgia's sake goes to the puppet Yoda (not CGI\, yay!) / Luke interaction and the Luke / Leia scene... a bit of an emotional one for me since I know it's the last time the two of them will ever share the screen.

For the haters who say this movie is man-hating\, politically correct drivel:  Get over it.  Yes\, most of the men in this movie were a little Homer-Simpsonish\, but you know what?  Women have put up with second-citizen representation in film for decades.  Sorry your feewings are hurt.  Also:  Yeah\, Luke is bitter and cynical.  A lot can happen in forty years.  No one scoffed at Obi Wan for becoming a hermit later in life.

Although I am a big SW franchise fan\, I'm not going to let myself get worked up over a few flaws in a movie.  I'm ready for the franchise to end (hopefully satisfyingly)\, though.
